body_html:
i just run bazel version and it returns:
Build label: 0.3.2
Build target: bazel-out/local-fastbuild/bin/src/main/java/com/google/devtools/build/lib/bazel/BazelServer_deploy.jar
Build time: Fri Oct 7 17:25:10 2016 (1475861110)
Build timestamp: 1475861110
Build timestamp as int: 1475861110

However, when i run sudo apt-get upgrade bazel, it returns:

bazel is already the newest version (0.4.1).

why these 2 versions are different, one is 0.3.2 and another is 0.4.1 ?

However, when i run sudo apt-get upgrade bazel, it returns:
bazel is already the newest version (0.4.1).
why these 2 versions are different, one is 0.3.2 and another is 0.4.1 ?
body:
i just run  **bazel version** and it returns:
**Build label: 0.3.2**
_Build target: bazel-out/local-fastbuild/bin/src/main/java/com/google/devtools/build/lib/bazel/BazelServer_deploy.jar
Build time: Fri Oct 7 17:25:10 2016 (1475861110)
Build timestamp: 1475861110
Build timestamp as int: 1475861110_


However, when i run **sudo apt-get upgrade bazel**, it returns: 

**bazel is already the newest version (0.4.1).**

why these 2 versions are different, one is 0.3.2 and another is 0.4.1 ?
